dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: I don't know, where are yours?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: I don't mean any offense... but what are you doing mixed up in all this?

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: I'm not mixed up in anything, hayseed.  What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: You just strike me as smart enough to be doing something else.

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm a real genius.  What choices have I got?  Fuck, just because I know about stuff like tonight doesn't mean I deal it.  I work a job.  It beats pumping gas, beats making hamburgers.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: You're telling me it doesn't get to you?

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: You can't sit there all day watching the parade of losers that comes into that place without going numb.  So what? Am I gonna go off and be a race car driver?  Go to Harvard?  Run for President?  What about you, pops?

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: I see a ring on your finger.  You have any kids?

dialogue.speaker: MAX
dialogue.text: So, you have a wife and kid waiting for you in Pennsylvania... what are you doing mixed up in all this?
